author: @JazmineFiClean

text:
A couple days ago, I was at the Maintenance shop getting new tires on my vehicle.  I had my 3yo and 2yo with me (3yo trained to touch the car and wait while I get 2yo inside and safe).  

My vehicle was ready to go and parked just outside the glass door where everyone could see us.  Took my babies out and gave my instructions expecting everything to be followed as usual.

Put 2yo in and got her partially buckled (minimal security so I can look away from her) then checked to make sure 3yo followed my instructions.  She didn't and wasn't in sight where my line of sight left her near me.

Shut door on 2yo, walked around car to get eyes on 3yo and found her immediately at her door not touching the vehicle.  I pick her up and see one of the gentlemen on the opposite side of the car. He was paying close attention to details I couldn't in the moment and I was so thankful to him.  Gave 3yo a quick lecture and told her to say thank you and put her in her seat.

I thank that man now and any other alert man who is still willing to help.  It's no excuse to let my guard down but it's nice to know I have that extra little bit of help when I see and experience it.

Also, at age 42, I'm just starting to get my gray hairs and my 20yo LOVES counting them for me. My younger siblings (ages 35 to 40 now) have been going gray and bald for the last 5 years.  I'm accused of coloring my hair like Mom does (also went gray in her 30s). I'm curious if I'll get any comments again this Christmas.
author: @TisOnlyAScratch

text: This is actually true.  When I was a kid, my grandma always talked about how she loved being old because she could steal from the grocery store and I thought she was joking. But then I literally watched her put cans of soup in her purse and winked at me. I thought it was unfair because I knew that she was pretty well off and rich, so I went and told the people at the front desk.My grandma was very mad. But the worst part was when she got confronted about the cans of soup in her purse, she immediately played it off like she had dementia and she didn't know where she was and she got away with it. üòÇ
author: @SelenaSecretShow

text: Ladies (or anyone), if you need a cane earlier in life (me in my late 30s) GET IT. People are so much kinder and more polite! Plus, you can get canes in all sorts of colors, designs, etc. I love my purple one, but I'm saving up for a black, hand carved wooden one with a crow face. OWN IT! Be the wild older lady who looks like she could teach your kids art (and do it if you can), but might hex you if you piss her off. Be mystical, fun, and a bit crazy. Lean into it!

text:
My mom did that in order to get the cashier to let her use a coupon for the wrong item to get the item.She wanted. Thing is, I don't think she meant to mess with him, and poor guy was also elderly.

Well, knowing her, she probably did mean to mess with him. Her whole life was a constant stream of messing with people and acting innocent.
